steps.name: Initial Reviewer
steps.description: Lucidia Core reviews the request for clarity, security compliance, and resource availability, then generates a preliminary execution plan.

steps.name: Task Distribution to Organization
steps.description: Route the task to one of the fifteen BlackRoad organizations based on the functional domain best equipped to handle it.

steps.name: Task Distribution to Team
steps.description: Refine and distribute the task to a specific team within the organization. Pause for manual approval (HITL) if the task involves high-risk operations.

steps.name: Task Update to Project
steps.description: Record the task in a GitHub Project board and synchronize metadata (Request ID, timeline) with Salesforce for enterprise audit.

steps.name: Task Distribution to Agent
steps.description: Instantiate or assign a specialized autonomous agent (e.g. fastapi-coder-agent, doctl-infrastructure-agent) using the Planner-Executor-Reflector pattern.

steps.name: Task Distribution to Repository
steps.description: Identify the target repository and create a new branch following GitHub Flow branching strategy for isolated testing.

steps.name: Task Distribution to Device
steps.description: Route to the device layer for physical execution such as firmware deployment to Raspberry Pi or DigitalOcean Droplet rebuild.

steps.name: Task Distribution to Drive
steps.description: Distribute artifacts (logs, reports, documentation) to Google Drive via a Service Account (GSA) pattern.

steps.name: Task Distribution to Cloudflare
steps.description: Execute network configuration changes such as Cloudflare Tunnel creation or DNS record modification.

steps.name: Task Distribution to Website Editor
steps.description: Route changes to an AI-driven website editor or headless CMS for autonomous content generation (landing pages, blog posts, documentation).
